intro: Cleretum flos-solis, commonly known as the sunflower of the morning, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Cleretum flos-solis thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats.
